questions.question_text: An engineer must deploy the Cisco Webex app to a Windows Virtual Desktop Infrastructure environment that has a roaming database named spark_roaming_store.db stored in a userâ€™s AppData\Roaming directory. Which two command-line arguments must be used when running the installer? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
look at the table under 
Installation arguments, explanations, and required privileges

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cloudCollaboration/wbxt/vdi/wbx-vdi-deployment-guide/wbx-teams-vdi-deployment_chapter_010.html#id_127338

ROAMINGENABLED=1 
If this argument is specified, then the roaming database (spark_roaming_store.db) is stored in the user's roaming directory (AppData\Roaming). Otherwise the roaming database is stored in AppData\Local.

This argument must be accompanied by ALLUSERS=1, otherwise the ROAMINGENABLED argument is ignored.
B. It provides a voice packet optimization solution.

questions.question_text: What is a capability of a Cisco IOS XE media resource?

choices.D: It provides redundancy for voice calls.
choices.B: It provides a voice packet optimization solution.
choices.A: It provides a hardware conferencing solution.

questions.question_text: What is the default TCP port for SIP OAuth made in Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
SIP Phone OAuth Port. Default value is 5090

Selected Answer: D
Checked this doc: https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/4efsep/Configure-call-forwarding#call-forwarding-in-userhub

I don't think it's A since it's refrring to Webex meetings, not calls.
It can't be B because if call waiting is active, calls are not forwarded.
C almost seems ok, but talks about forwarding calls to the "voicemail of a mobile phone", when the doc refers to internal phones instead ("This option is only available for selection if you've entered a valid internal phone number with voicemail service enabled").
D matches what the doc says under "Forward all calls": "Select Play a brief tone for forwarded calls to play a brief tone whenever a call is forwarded", so going with that.

comments.content:
The call forwarding feature in a Cisco Webex dial plan allows users to forward calls to another phone number or directly to voicemail. Specifically, it can forward calls when there is no answer, which aligns with option C: "It forwards calls to the voicemail of a mobile phone when there is no answer"

https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/n0owpbq/Forward-your-phone-calls-to-another-number
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/nkw9o41/Configure-call-forwarding-for-users-and-workspaces

questions.question_text: What is a capability of the call forwarding feature in a Cisco Webex dial plan?

choices.B: It forwards calls when a line is busy by enabling the call waiting feature.
choices.A: It provides the ability to forward a Webex meeting to another user.
choices.C: It forwards calls to the voicemail of a mobile phone when there is no answer.
choices.D: It chooses a tone to be played when forwarding all calls.

questions.question_text: Which command enables SIP OAuth mode on a Cisco UCM publisher node?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
there are:
 utils sipOAuth-mode enable
 utils sipOAuth-mode disable

Selected Answer: B
Enable SIP OAuth Mode
Use the Command Line Interface to enable SIP OAuth mode. Enabling this feature on the publisher node also enables the feature on all cluster nodes.
Procedure
Step 1

On the Unified Communications Manager publisher node, log in to the Command Line Interface.

Step 2

Run the utils sipOAuth-mode enable CLI command.

Selected Answer: B
Use the Publisher's Command Line Interface to enable SIP OAuth mode globally. Run the command: utils sipOAuth-mode enable.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/jabber/215572-cisco-jabber-and-sip-oauth-mode.html
